s.text: Heritage Foundation analyst Ron Utt points out that the 70 biggest U.S. airports, which serve 90 percent of commercial air travelers, get less federal money each year than the 3,233 smaller ones that cater almost exclusively to private fliers.
JFK Jr. was pretty normal for a private pilot--a hard-charger who fell in love with the freedom, excitement, and romance of private aviation.
Commercial passengers frequently find themselves trapped in holding patterns over the nation's biggest and busiest airports as corporate turboprops carrying a few people land.
7 billion in grants to general aviation airports to pay for construction and improvement and has given federally owned land to 450 airports.
